sn8.9:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn8.9:4.2: Then Venerable Koṇḍañña Who Understood approached the Buddha after a very long absence.
sn8.9:4.3: He fell with his head to the Buddha’s feet, caressing them and covering them with kisses, and pronounced his name:
sn8.9:4.4: “I am Koṇḍañña, Blessed One! I am Koṇḍañña, Holy One!”
sn8.9:4.6: “This Venerable Koṇḍañña Who Understood has approached the Buddha after a very long absence.
sn8.9:4.7: He fell with his head to the Buddha’s feet, caressing them and covering them with kisses, and pronounced his name:
sn8.9:4.8: ‘I am Koṇḍañña, Blessed One! I am Koṇḍañña, Holy One!’
sn8.9:4.9: Why don’t I extoll him in the Buddha’s presence with appropriate verses?”
sn8.9:5.1: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
sn8.9:5.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn8.9:5.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn8.9:5.4: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled Koṇḍañña in the Buddha’s presence with appropriate verses.
